alert.note: Alert for Salt Lake (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 17 at 11:51AM MDT until April 19 at 9:00AM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Utah... Emigration Creek Along Salt Lake City`s East Bench affecting Salt Lake County. .Warm temperatures Monday and rain on snow Tuesday will melt snowpack and increase river flows. For Emigration Creek...including Salt Lake City`s East Bench... action stage is forecast. Flood stage is possible Monday night into Tuesday morning and again Tuesday night into Wednesday morning. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Emigration Creek Near Salt Lake City`s East Bench. * WHEN...Until late Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 130 cfs, minor flood damage will impact homes and structures along the stream, including areas of the Hogle Zoo. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Current flow is 62 cfs and falling. - Forecast...Emigration Creek will begin to rise again this afternoon to action stage and potentially reaching flood stage tonight. Flows will fall below action stage once again Tuesday morning. A repeat of this cycle is expected Tuesday evening into Wednesday morning. Peak flows near 140 cfs are possible both nights near midnight. - Action flow is 110 cfs. - Flood flow is 130 cfs. &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1100 PM MDT.
